DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to measure the acute renal dysfunction on the first, second, seventh and twentieth days.
DOC.brief_title: Prevention of Perioperative Acute Renal Failure
DOC.criteria: All patients who are undergoing elective abdominal surgery after appropriate information of the study, and its possible risks that may arise therefrom and that at any time to refuse their cooperation, give a written consent to participate in the study. Patients who at the time of the interview have an ASA between 2 and 4. Patients with chronic kidney failure mild moderate (serum creatinine between 1.5 and 3.0 mg / dl) can be included. Chronic kidney diseases with serum creatinine higher than 3.0 mg /DL Laparoscopic abdominal surgery ASA 1 and ASA 5 patients. Patients with cardiac insufficiency, ascites and respiratory insufficiency Diastolic hypertension > 100 mmHg
